Class GameRenderer

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GameRenderer
public class GameRenderer extends Object
This is the Painter class. It handles all the graphics. It draws the board, the falling brick, the ghost and the 'Next Brick' preview. If screen looks ugly, blame this class.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameRenderer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanel)
    Setup the painter with the 3 main Panels.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameRenderer

      public GameRenderer(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane nextBrickPanel)
      Setup the painter with the 3 main Panels.

  • Method Details

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initialize the view when game starts. To create all the empty rectangles first and put them in the grid. Then just change their color, no need create new object every time .
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - The logical grid of the game.
      brick - The current falling brick data.

    • renderGame

      public void renderGame(ViewData brick, GameController controller)
      This is the main draw loop. Clear old ghost.Draw new ghost.Update the falling brick position.
      Parameters:
      brick - Current falling brick.
      controller - We need this to ask where the ghost should be.

    • refreshBackground

      public void refreshBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the board background. When a brick lands, it becomes part of the board, so we paint it here.

    • clearEverything

      public void clearEverything()
      Wipe everything clean.Used when game over or restarting.

    • updateNextBricks

      public void updateNextBricks(List<int[][]> nextBricks)
      Draws the upcoming bricks in the side panel. A bit complex math here to make sure the bricks are centered nicely.
